Module com.example.dds_konfigurator
Package com.dds_konfigurator

Class MainController

java.lang.Object
com.dds_konfigurator.MainController
public class MainController extends Object
This Class is used to connect to the JavaFX GUI which is formatted inside a FXML file.
The names of the inputs are defined by the "id"-tag in the FXML file The class has an implemented basic input validation

    • buildString

      public String buildString(int mode)
      This method is used to build a String, in a format, that is usable by the DDS, it has the form:
      Mode 1: {mode;static frequency;0;0;0;0}
      Mode 2: {mode;start frequency;end frequency;0; number steps; sweeptime}
      Mode 3: {mode;start frequency;end frequency; number decades; 0; sweeptime}
      Mode 4: {Teststring}
      Parameters:
      mode - This is used to set the mode {1 = static frequency; 2 = linear wobble; 3 = logarithmic wobble; 4 = testmode}
      Returns:
      Returns the complete String that was build

    • showAbout

      public void showAbout() throws IOException
      This method is used to show a "About" window
      Throws:
      IOException - Throws an IOException if an error occurs during the launch

    • isValidNetwork

      public boolean isValidNetwork(javafx.scene.control.TextField ip, javafx.scene.control.TextField port)
      Input Validation for a given IP and port
      Parameters:
      ip - The IP textfield that will be checked
      port - The port textfield that will be checked
      Returns:
      Return true if input is valid, false if input is invalid

    • isValidFrequency

      public boolean isValidFrequency(javafx.scene.control.TextField MHz, javafx.scene.control.TextField kHz, javafx.scene.control.TextField Hz)
      Input Validation for a given frequency
      Parameters:
      MHz - The Mhz textfield that will be checked
      kHz - The khz textfield that will be checked
      Hz - The Hz textfield that will be checked
      Returns:
      Return true if input is valid, false if input is invalid
